page.title: 16OLD PEOPLES SHELTERED HOMES
page.content: In Weasenham St Peter there are 8 flatlets and 8 bungalows owned by the Breckland District Council which are lived in by elderly people who are in the care of a warden and deputy.The warden calls every morning to check that the people are well and does any shopping or pension collecting if needed. The local shopkeeper delivers groceries and the village delivery vans call at the sheltered homes. The doctor from Litcham calls on Mondays and the one from Massingham visits on Fridays. The Vicar takes a special Holy Communion Service once a month. There is a community room and once a fortnight games such as bingo and whist are arranged. An "Age Concern" minibus runs to and from Fakenham on a Thursday and can be hired for special trips if wanted.
